basics.name: Raymond Acker
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: I am studying for a B.S. in Computer Science in the Department of Information and Computer Sciences at the University of Hawaii. I expect to graduate in Spring, 2024.

education.institution: University of Hawaii at Manoa, Honolulu, HI

courses: United States Military Apprenticeship Program: Electronics Technician (Professional & Kindred)
Broadcast Keying Station (BKS)/Submarine Message Gateway (SMG) Maintenance Technician
SEAL Delivery Vehicle (SDV) Electronics Maintenance Technician
Air Mobility Command Aircraft Planners Course

education.institution: Embry-Riddle Aeronautical University, Daytona Beach, FL

work.summary: Oversee projects for PSHI/ASGI on Oahu island.
work.highlights: Responsible for five employee projects and three installations.

work.summary: T/s, repaired, and operated electronics in communications, RADAR, and a wide variety of other fields.
highlights: Completed training and qualification courses for: COMSECMAINTECH, UHF/DMR, VLF BKS/SMG, Antenna Maintenance, SEAL Delivery Vehicles, Asst. Security Manager, Electronics Technician (Professional & Kindred) Journeyman

volunteer.organization: John Hopkins University Human Language Technology Center of Excellence (HLTCoE)
volunteer.summary: Lead projects for Japanese and TULAROSA character recognition projects. Assisted IT department in remote assistance for onboarding and setting up equipment and software for new members.
Assisted in the construction of stage set pieces and stage setting at UH Windward Community College and Diamond Head Theater.
highlights: Grease, Man of LaMancha, The SpongeBob Musical, Gypsy, Far and Away

awards.title: Letter of Appreciation
awards.awarder: John Hopkins University Human Language Technology Center of Excellence
awards.summary: LoA from the Director Emeritus, Officer in Charge, and Operations Director for volunteer efforts in leading the Japanese language project, co-leading the TULAROSA project, and completing 9,000+ annotations.

awards.title: Navy and Marine Corps Achievement Medal (NAM) (x4)
awards.summary: For actions taken while stationed onboard the USS TRUXTUN (DDG 103), at COMSUBGRU7, and at NSWG8LOGSUPPU.
